metadata.title: CVE-2019-14892 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was discovered in jackson-databind in versions before 2.9.10,2.8.11.5 and 2.6.7.3, where it would permit polymorphic deserialization ofa malicious object using commons-configuration 1 and 2 JNDI classes. Anattacker could use this flaw to execute arbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14892` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjackson2-databind-java - 2.10.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jackson-databind package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.0-2').
